title: New Device Can Immediately Target And Destroy Deadly Blood Clots
claim: A new device can immediately target and destroy deadly blood clots.
published_paper_title: Multifunctional Thrombin-Activatable Polymer Capsules for Specific Targeting to Activated Platelets
published_paper_abstract: Hemostasis is a key biological feature that prevents sustained bleeding upon injury.1 Acute thrombosis, a leading cause of mortalities and morbidities worldwide, is a pathological hemostatic condition, which is mainly caused by the rupture of an unstable atherosclerotic plaque leading to myocardial infarction or stroke.1, 2 These unwanted intravascular blood thrombi cause vascular occlusions and organ damage due to prolonged lack of oxygen.[1] As a first line of defense, fast-acting thrombolytic drugs, such as plasminogen activators (PAs), are administered to stop thrombus growth and to quickly induce thrombus deconstruction.3 However, systemic (intravenous) or local (catheter) delivery of PAs is deemed neither effective nor safe due to either rapid neutralization by their antidotes (e.g., plasminogen activator inhibitor) or bleeding complications that may lead to intracranial hemorrhages.1 With no safe thrombolytic treatments currently available and a lack of timely treatments, acute thrombosis remains a major healthcare issue contributing to a significant number of deaths and disabilities.

[1] As a first line of defense, fast-acting thrombolytic drugs, such as plasminogen activators (PAs), are administered to stop thrombus growth and to quickly induce thrombus deconstruction.3 However, systemic (intravenous) or local (catheter) delivery of PAs is deemed neither effective nor safe due to either rapid neutralization by their antidotes (e.g., plasminogen activator inhibitor) or bleeding complications that may lead to intracranial hemorrhages.1 With no safe thrombolytic treatments currently available and a lack of timely treatments, acute thrombosis remains a major healthcare issue contributing to a significant number of deaths and disabilities.

title: No, Having More Sex Will Not Make You Happier, Study Reveals
claim: Having more sex will not make you happier.
published_paper_title: Money, Sex and Happiness: An Empirical Study
published_paper_abstract: The links between income, sexual behavior and reported happiness are studied using recent data on a sample of 16,000 adult Americans. The paper finds that sexual activity enters strongly positively in happiness equations. Higher income does not buy more sex or more sexual partners. Married people have more sex than those who are single, divorced, widowed or separated. The happiness-maximizing number of sexual partners in the previous year is calculated to be 1. Highly educated females tend to have fewer sexual partners. Homosexuality has no statistically significant effect on happiness.

Abstract:

2. Higher income does not buy more sex or more sexual partners.
3. Married people have more sex than those who are single, divorced, widowed or separated.
4. The happiness-maximizing number of sexual partners in the previous year is calculated to be 1.
5. Highly educated females tend to have fewer sexual partners.
6. Homosexuality has no statistically significant effect on happiness.
